Action Map

State

POKT HoldingsThe personal holdings of the application in uPOKTuPOKT
Staked POKTThe staked amount of the application in uPOKTuPOKT

GeoZoneThe physical geo-location identifier this Servicer registered inGeoZone
Number of ServicersThe number of servicers an application would prefer, if available, for a session.int
Stake StatusThe status of staking for the actorStakeStatusType
Unstaking HeightThe height for which a servicer has begun unstaking at or none to represent no unstakingBlock Height
DelegateThe portal which has been delegated to or None if there is no delegatePortal Entity

Behavioral Action Space

Service Leave

Action for Service moving to leave the system.

Called By:

1. Service

Constraints:

Portal Registration

Registration differs from staking in the sense that the pubKey is known but there are no economic benefits/penalties in this stage of the protocol's progression. The Portal must register on-chain in order for the Servicer to accept its signature as part of the ring. Future versions of the protocol may include on-chain rewards or penalties for the Portal, but the current iteration will incentivize Portals to provide a high quality, highly trusted service through free market economics.

Called By:

1. Portal

Constraints:

Service Join

Action for Service moving to be added to the system.

Called By:

1. Service

Constraints:

Submit Relay Request

An application or the portal acting on its behalf submits a Relay Request, or an API requests to be routed to any Service

Called By:

1. Application

2. Portal

Constraints:

Policies

Service Leave Policy

The policy which decides whether a service is able to leave the system.

Preceded By:

1. Service Leave

Domain Spaces:

1. Service Leave Space

Followed By:

1. Remove Service

Codomain Spaces:

1. Service Leave Space

Constraints:

Portal Registration Policy

Policy which handles the logic of portal registration and if enough stake is present. The portal is also added to the global state if it is approved.

Preceded By:

1. Portal Registration

Domain Spaces:

1. Portal Registration Space

Followed By:

1. Modify Portal POKT Holdings

2. Modify Portal Stake

3. Add New Portal

Codomain Spaces:

1. Modify Portal POKT Space

2. Modify Portal POKT Space

3. Portal Registration Space

Constraints:

Service Join Policy

The policy which decides whether a service can be added to the system.

Preceded By:

1. Service Join

Domain Spaces:

1. Service Join Space

Followed By:

1. Add New Service

Codomain Spaces:

1. Service Join Space

Constraints:

Policy Options:

1. Service Join Policy V1

Basic policy option.

Logic: If the servicer id is in the supported_services parameter and it is not already present in the system, continue the action chain. Otherwise terminate.


Submit Relay Request Policy

The policy for determining aspects of the service request.

Preceded By:

1. Submit Relay Request

Domain Spaces:

1. Submit Relay Request Space

Followed By:

1. Create New Session

Codomain Spaces:

Constraints:

Policy Options:

1. Submit Relay Request Policy Option V1

V1 Implementation

Logic: During each Session, the amount of POKT an Application has staked (see Application Protocol for more details) is mapped to "Service Tokens" that represent the amount of work a Servicer can provide using the SessionTokenBucketCoefficient governance parameter. The Token Bucket rate limiting algorithm is used to determine the maximum number of requests a Servicer can relay, and be rewarded for, thereby disincentivizing it to process relays for the Application once the cap is reached. At the beginning of the session, each Servicer initializes: AppSessionTokens = (AppStakeAmount * SessionTokenBucketCoefficient) / NumServicersPerSession. When one of the Servicers in the session is out of session tokens, the Application can continue to use other Servicers until every they are all exhausted. The mechanism described above enables future iterations of the protocol where different types of request may vary the required number of AppSessionTokens per request. The selection of servicers is random but assigns higher probability for higher QoS servicers.


Mechanisms

Remove Service

Mechanism which removes services

Preceded By:

1. Service Leave Policy

Domain Spaces:

1. Service Leave Space

State Updates:

1. Global.Services

Constraints:

Logic:

The service in DOMAIN[0] is removed.

Modify Portal POKT Holdings

The mechanism to update the personal holdings of a portal

Preceded By:

1. Portal Registration Policy

2. Return Portal Stake Policy

Domain Spaces:

1. Modify Portal POKT Space

State Updates:

1. Portal.POKT Holdings

Constraints:

Logic:

The portal at DOMAIN[0].portal_address has its POKT Holdings modified by DOMAIN[0].value

Modify Portal Stake

The mechanism to update the stake of a portal

Preceded By:

1. Portal Registration Policy

2. Return Portal Stake Policy

Domain Spaces:

1. Modify Portal POKT Space

State Updates:

1. Portal.Staked POKT

Constraints:

Logic:

The portal at DOMAIN[0].portal_address has its stake modified by DOMAIN[0].value

Add New Portal

The mechanism for adding a new portal to the global state

Preceded By:

1. Portal Registration Policy

Domain Spaces:

1. Portal Registration Space

State Updates:

1. Global.Portals

Constraints:

Logic:

The portal at DOMAIN[0].portal_address is added to the global state

Add New Service

Create a new service entity from the message and add it to the global state

Preceded By:

1. Service Join Policy

Domain Spaces:

1. Service Join Space

State Updates:

1. Global.Services

Constraints:

Logic:

DOMAIN[0] is used to create the new service and then it is appended to the global state's services.

Create New Session

The mechanism which creates and adds a new session with which servicers will do relays on.

Preceded By:

1. Submit Relay Request Policy

Domain Spaces:

1. Submit Relay Request Space

State Updates:

1. Global.Sessions

Constraints:

Logic:

Take DOMAIN[0] and create a new session, then append to the global state.

Parameters

session_token_bucket_coefficient

portal_minimum_stake

supported_services
